intro: Psilotum vieillardii, commonly known as the slender whisk fern, is a unique vascular plant belonging to the family Psilotaceae. It is characterized by its simple, branching stems and tiny, scale-like leaves that are often mistaken for roots. The plant lacks true leaves, roots, and flowers, and instead has specialized structures called rhizoids for anchoring and nutrient absorption. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in tropical and subtropical regions. Psilotum vieillardii is an ancient lineage of plants, representing a primitive form of vascular plant evolution.
